Prerequisites: C OR HIGHER IN EITHER QMB1001 OR MAT1033 OR APPROPRIATE PLACEMENT SCORE, AND SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF ALL DEVELOPMENTAL WRITING AND READING COURSES.
Course Description: STUDENTS WILL BE INTODUCED TO THE FIELD OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING. THE COURSE EMPHASISES THE ANALYSIS OF BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS AND THE STUDY OF THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE. TOPICAL AREAS IN THE COURSE INCLUDE  ACCRUAL-BASED ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS, INTERNAL CONTROLS, FINANCIAL STATEMENT PREPARATION, AND ACCOUNTING ELEMENTS OF A CORPORATE BUSINESS ENTITY. ETHICAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS ARE EMBEDDED THROUGHOUT THE COURSE MATERIALS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
